channel.title: POD on! - The Spot on Podcast

item.title: Too much internet?
item.description: There is a whole universe to explore on the internet - people to meet, music to hear, things to learn ... But can the internet also be bad for you? Can you even get addicted to it? In the June Spot on and in this podcast, we talk about the dangers of the online world.
item.itunes:subtitle: Do you spend too much time online?
item.dc:creator: Carrie Andrews

item.title: Mind the gap (year)!
item.description: What's after school, but before university or a job? Lots of people use this time to do a gap year – to explore the world, meet new people and learn new languages. There are lots of wonderful ways to fill your gap year. In the June Spot on and in this podcast, we talk about some of the options.

item.title: Horoscopes: what the stars say
item.description: Do you read your horoscope? Whether or not you believe in astrology, reading and talking about horoscopes can be a fun way to practise your English. That's why the May Spot on VocAB! is all about horoscopes. And in the podcast, we talk about what the stars have to say about us.

item.title: Easy English, better English
item.description: Richard's foolproof guide to better English is in the May Spot on, bringing you lots of tips for using everyday situations to practise your English. And in the podcast we have a few more ideas for you, as Carrie talks about some of her favourite things to do.

item.title: Food and the city – New York yum!
item.description: New York City isn't just famous for being the one of the most exciting cities in the world. It's also super famous for its food. Hot dogs, bagels, egg creams and more – you can read about some of the yummiest NY food in the May Spot on and we talk about some of our favourites in the podcast.

item.title: Keeping up with Ed Sheeran
item.description: The past year has been very big for British musician Ed Sheeran. The singer had a huge hit with his album +, and his first single "The A Team". You can hear what the singer had to say in the next edition of Spot on Audio, on sale starting 30 May. In the podcast, we have a short preview for you.

item.title: Bad habits
item.description: We all have bad habits and we all have pet peeves – the habits that other people have that annoy us. In the April Spot on, Rebecca Jenkins in London talks about the bad habits that Londoners have. In the podcast, Richard shares some of his pet peeves.

item.title: Emergency words
item.description: We never expect them, but sometimes emergencies happen. What can you expect to happen in an emergency? What should you do? In the April Spot on VocAB, we give you lots of words about different types of emergency situations. And in the podcast, you'll hear a few more.

item.title: English & travel – tips for the road
item.description: We travel to experience new things – and sometimes the unexpected happens. Is your English ready? In the April Spot on, you can take our fun English quiz to find out. And in the podcast, Richard and Carrie discuss what happens when things go wrong.
item.itunes:summary: We travel to see new places, meet new people and to experience new things – and sometimes the unexpected happens. Chances are you'll need to use your English in some of these new situations. In the April Spot on, you can take our test to find out if your English is ready to hit the road. And in the podcast, Richard and Carrie discuss what happens when things go wrong.
item.itunes:subtitle: Is your English ready for the world?
item.dc:creator: Carrie Andrews
